etymology.description: 亻(人) (rén, "person") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") or 亻(人) (rén, "person") + 寸(寸) (cùn, "hand") = person giving with hand -> to deliver, hand over
etymology.interpretation: The character 付(付) (fù, "hand over") combines 亻(人) (rén, "person") with a hand component. It visually represents the action of a person handing something over to another, emphasizing the act of giving or delivering.

examples.chinese: 我把钱付给他(我把錢付給他)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bǎ qián fù gěi tā.
examples.english: I handed the money to him.

examples.chinese: 他急忙把票款付给售票员(他急忙把票款付給售票員)，以便赶上电影(以便趕上電影)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jímáng bǎ piào kuǎn fù gěi shòupiàoyuán, yǐbiàn gǎn shàng diànyǐng.
examples.english: He hurriedly handed the ticket payment to the ticket seller to catch the movie.
